original: @280b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @280b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya pra dzny'a p'a ra mi t'a hri da ya by'a khy'a /
analyzed: a'arya pra dzny'a p'a ra mi t'a hri da ya by'a khy'a /
translated: Ārya-prajñāpāramitāhṛdayavyākhyā

original: bod skad du /🔽'phags pa shes @281a * //🔽rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po'i rnam par bshad pa /
analyzed: bod skad du / 'phags pa shes @281a * // rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po'i rnam par bshad pa /
translated: In Tibetan:🔽'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po'i rnam par bshad pa

original: bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed Lady, Perfection of Wisdom.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po'o zhes bya ba ni mdo'i mtshan nyid brjod pas na bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po'o zhes bya ba ni mdo'i mtshan nyid brjod pas na bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, the Blessed Lady, the Heart of the Perfection of Wisdom, is called the Heart of the Perfection of Wisdom because it expresses the defining characteristics of the sūtra.

original: thog ma kho nar ming ma btags na mdo gang yin gtol med pa'i phyir ming smos so //
analyzed: thog ma kho nar ming ma btags na mdo gang yin gtol med pa'i phyir ming smos so //
translated: The name is mentioned because if it is not given at the very beginning, it is unclear which sūtra it is.

original: ming btags pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: ming btags pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is the name given,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po 'di'i mdo thams cad kyang 'dir ma 'dus pa med pas mdo'i yang mdo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po 'di'i mdo thams cad kyang 'dir ma 'dus pa med pas mdo'i yang mdo zhes bya'o //
translated: but also because all the sūtras of this Heart of the Perfection of Wisdom are included here without exception, it is called the Heart of the Sūtras.

original: de la bcom zhes bya ba ni bdud bzhi bcom pa ste /
analyzed: de la bcom zhes bya ba ni bdud bzhi bcom pa ste /
translated: Here, conqueror means the conqueror of the four demons.

original: phung po'i bdud la sogs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don 'dis bdud btsal du mi rnyed cing bdud thams cad mi gnas pa'i phyir bcom pa'o //
analyzed: phung po'i bdud la sogs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don 'dis bdud btsal du mi rnyed cing bdud thams cad mi gnas pa'i phyir bcom pa'o //
translated: The demon of the aggregates and so forth are conquered by this meaning of the perfection of wisdom, because the demon is not found when sought, and all demons do not abide.

original: ldan zhes bya ba ni legs pa drug dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: ldan zhes bya ba ni legs pa drug dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Endowed means endowed with the six excellences.

original: mkhyen pa'i yon tan thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i byin gyi rlabs las byung bas na ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mkhyen pa'i yon tan thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i byin gyi rlabs las byung bas na ldan pa'o //
translated: Since all the qualities of knowledge also arise from the blessing of the perfection of wisdom, it is endowed.

original: 'das zhes bya ba ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: 'das zhes bya ba ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Gone beyond means non-abiding nirvana.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gyi sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa thams cad bzlog ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gyi sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa thams cad bzlog ste /
translated: The meaning of the perfection of wisdom turns back all mind, mentality, and consciousness.

original: bag chags thams cad dang bral bas na 'das zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bag chags thams cad dang bral bas na 'das zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is free from all habitual tendencies, it is called gone beyond.

original: ma zhes bya ba ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don spyad pa las byung /
analyzed: ma zhes bya ba ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don spyad pa las byung /
translated: Mother means that all buddhas of the three times also arise from practicing the meaning of the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gyis bskyed pas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yum du gyur pas na ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gyis bskyed pas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yum du gyur pas na ma zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is generated by the meaning of the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of wisdom is called “mother” because it becomes the mother of all buddhas.

original: shes rab ces bya ba ni thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa'i shes rab rnam pa gsum gyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas na shes rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab ces bya ba ni thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa'i shes rab rnam pa gsum gyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas na shes rab ces bya'o //
translated: “Wisdom” is called wisdom because it is the correct knowledge by means of the three kinds of wisdom: the wisdom of hearing, the wisdom of contemplation, and the wisdom of meditation.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyis chos gang yang rjes su ma mthong ba'i phyir mtshan ma dang mtha' gnyis dang skye shi las 'das pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyis chos gang yang rjes su ma mthong ba'i phyir mtshan ma dang mtha' gnyis dang skye shi las 'das pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “Perfection” is called a perfection because it is beyond the two extremes of signs and birth and death because of not seeing any phenomena with wisdom.

original: snying po zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa'i nang nas zab mo mchog thams cad mdo nyung ngu 'di'i nang du ma 'dus pa med pas na snying po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snying po zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa'i nang nas zab mo mchog thams cad mdo nyung ngu 'di'i nang du ma 'dus pa med pas na snying po zhes bya'o //
translated: “Essence” is called an essence because there is nothing that is not included in this short sūtra of all the supreme and profound [teachings] from within the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Stanzas and so forth.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha @281b rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa'i mdo las kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha @281b rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa'i mdo las kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal na /
translated: The phrase Homage to the Transcendent Perfection of Wisdom is also found in the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines, which states, If you pay homage to the perfection of wisdom,🔽it is as if you have paid homage to all the buddhas of the three times.

original: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad la phyag 'tshal ba dang 'dra'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa dang / mchod pa'i phyir phyag 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad la phyag 'tshal ba dang 'dra'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa dang / mchod pa'i phyir phyag 'tshal ba'o //
translated: Thus, the homage is paid in order to accumulate merit and make offerings.

original: da ni gzhung ste /
analyzed: da ni gzhung ste /
translated: Now, the text itself.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la mgo mjug tu don rnam pa bdun gyis gsal bar bshad de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la mgo mjug tu don rnam pa bdun gyis gsal bar bshad de /
translated: This perfection of wisdom is clearly explained from beginning to end in seven topics.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: gleng gzhi dang / shes rab la 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / shes rab kyi spyod yul dang / shes rab kyi yon tan dang / shes rab kyi 'bras bu dang / shes rab kyi gzungs so //
analyzed: gleng gzhi dang / shes rab la 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / shes rab kyi spyod yul dang / shes rab kyi yon tan dang / shes rab kyi 'bras bu dang / shes rab kyi gzungs so //
translated: They are the introduction, the entry into wisdom, the characteristics of emptiness, the domain of wisdom, the qualities of wisdom, the result of wisdom, and the dhāraṇī of wisdom.

original: de la gleng gzhi ni 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la gleng gzhi ni 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The nidana is from “Thus have I heard” up to “in the great city of Rajagriha.”🔽

original: thabs cig tu bzhugs te zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: thabs cig tu bzhugs te zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The introduction is from “Thus have I heard” up to “they were dwelling together.

original: shes rab la 'jug pa ni phung po lnga yang rang bzhin gyis stong par blta'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //🔽stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni thob pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: shes rab la 'jug pa ni phung po lnga yang rang bzhin gyis stong par blta'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o // stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni thob pa yang ma yin /
translated: ” The introduction to wisdom is from “The five aggregates should be seen as empty by nature” up to the end.

original: ma thob pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: ma thob pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The definition of emptiness is from “It is not attainment” up to “it is not non-attainment.”

original: shes rab kyi spyod yul ni thob pa med par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi spyod yul ni thob pa med par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The domain of wisdom is from “Abiding in the perfection of wisdom without attainment, one practices” up to the end.

original: shes rab kyi yon tan ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar phyin to zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi yon tan ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar phyin to zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The qualities of wisdom are from “One reaches the end of nirvana” up to the end.

original: shes rab kyi 'bras bu ni byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi 'bras bu ni byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The result of wisdom is from “One fully awakens to perfect buddhahood” up to the end.

original: shes rab kyi gzungs ni mjug gi sngags yan chad do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi gzungs ni mjug gi sngags yan chad do //
translated: The dharani of wisdom is from the concluding mantra onward.

original: da ni gleng gzhi'i don bshad de /
analyzed: da ni gleng gzhi'i don bshad de /
translated: Now, the meaning of the nidana is explained.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i mdo sde thams cad 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis gsan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i mdo sde thams cad 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis gsan te /
translated: Thus have I heard means that all the Mahayana sutras were heard by noble Manjushri.

original: bsdus pas na bdag gis thos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsdus pas na bdag gis thos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: By condensing, it is called Thus have I heard.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ba ni shes rab kyi snying po'i rnam grangs ji snyed brjod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ba ni shes rab kyi snying po'i rnam grangs ji snyed brjod pa nyid do //
translated: There, thus means the extent of the enumeration of the essence of wisdom.

original: bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs kyi drung nas mnyan te /
analyzed: bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs kyi drung nas mnyan te /
translated: I have heard means that it was heard from the feet of the Bhagavan.

original: dpal gyi mgur nas gsungs pa mngon sum du rna ba'i dbang pos thos pa'o //
analyzed: dpal gyi mgur nas gsungs pa mngon sum du rna ba'i dbang pos thos pa'o //
translated: It was directly heard with the ear faculty from the glorious throat.

original: dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi snying po dus gzhan na bshad pa la mi bya'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po'i khab na 'khor 'di rnams la lan cig kho na zhig bshad pa'i dus la bya'o //
analyzed: dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi snying po dus gzhan na bshad pa la mi bya'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po'i khab na 'khor 'di rnams la lan cig kho na zhig bshad pa'i dus la bya'o //
translated: At one time means that the essence of wisdom should not be explained at another time.

original: bcom @282a * //
analyzed: bcom @282a * //
translated: It should be explained at the time when the Bhagavan explains it only once to this retinue in Rajagriha.

original: ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni de la ston pa ni su zhig yin /
analyzed: ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni de la ston pa ni su zhig yin /
translated: Bhagavan means what is the teacher?

original: yul ni gang zhig na /🔽'khor ni gang gang yin /
analyzed: yul ni gang zhig na / 'khor ni gang gang yin /
translated: What is the place?🔽What is the assembly?

original: 'dus nas don ci zhig mdzad de /
analyzed: 'dus nas don ci zhig mdzad de /
translated: What is the purpose of the assembly?

original: ston pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: ston pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The teacher is the Lord Buddha.

original: yul ni rgyal po'i khab kyi bya rgod phung po'i ri la /
analyzed: yul ni rgyal po'i khab kyi bya rgod phung po'i ri la /
translated: The place is Vulture Peak Mountain near Rajagriha.

original: 'khor ni dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang ; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams so //
analyzed: 'khor ni dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang ; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams so //
translated: The assembly is the great community of monks and the bodhisattva-mahasattvas.

original: 'dus nas don ci zhig mdzad ce na /
analyzed: 'dus nas don ci zhig mdzad ce na /
translated: What is the purpose of the assembly?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po 'di ston to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po 'di ston to //
translated: It is to teach this Heart of the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: de la tshig gnyer bshad pa ni gong ma dang 'dra /
analyzed: de la tshig gnyer bshad pa ni gong ma dang 'dra /
translated: The explanation of the words is the same as above.

original: rgyal po'i khab bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri la zhes bya ba ni rgyal po gzugs can snying po'i yon tan las grags te /
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri la zhes bya ba ni rgyal po gzugs can snying po'i yon tan las grags te /
translated: Vulture Peak Mountain near Rajagriha is known from the qualities of King Bimbisara.

original: yul ljongs kyi grong khyer spyi'i ming du btags pa'o //
analyzed: yul ljongs kyi grong khyer spyi'i ming du btags pa'o //
translated: It is the general name of a city in the countryside.

original: bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri zhes bya ba ni yul ljongs de rgya che bas bya rgod phung po'i ri ste mtho la bya mang po 'du ba'i phyir ming du btags pa'o //
analyzed: bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri zhes bya ba ni yul ljongs de rgya che bas bya rgod phung po'i ri ste mtho la bya mang po 'du ba'i phyir ming du btags pa'o //
translated: The Vulture Peak is so called because the mountain is high and many vultures gather there.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po zhes bya ba ni mthu che ba dang grangs mang ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po zhes bya ba ni mthu che ba dang grangs mang ba'o //
translated: The great community of monks refers to their great power and great number.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun chen po zhes pa ni thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don phun sum tshogs pa mngon sum du chud cing gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mang po'o
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun chen po zhes pa ni thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don phun sum tshogs pa mngon sum du chud cing gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mang po'o
translated: The great community of bodhisattvas refers to the many bodhisattvas who have directly realized the perfection of wisdom and who also establish others in the perfection of wisdom.

original: // thabs cig tu bzhugs te zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das 'khor mang pos bskor te bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: // thabs cig tu bzhugs te zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das 'khor mang pos bskor te bzhugs pa'o //
translated: They dwelt together means that the Blessed One dwelt surrounded by a great retinue.

original: 'di yan chad ni gleng gzhi'o //
analyzed: 'di yan chad ni gleng gzhi'o //
translated: Up to this point is the introduction.

original: da ni shes rab la 'jug pa'i don gyis bshad de /
analyzed: da ni shes rab la 'jug pa'i don gyis bshad de /
translated: Now, the meaning of entering into wisdom will be explained.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das chos kyi rnam grangs zab mo snang ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das chos kyi rnam grangs zab mo snang ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: At that time, the Lord entered the concentration called the appearance of the profound Dharma-discourse.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das 'khor de dag dang / sems can thams cad la thugs brtse zhing byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das 'khor de dag dang / sems can thams cad la thugs brtse zhing byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
translated: There, the Lord entered into concentration in order to bless and have compassion for that assembly and all sentient beings.

original: de la chos kyi rnam grangs zab mo snang ba zhes bya ba ni chos kyi gzhung 'dis chos thams cad dmigs pa dang mtha' thams cad las 'das par ston cing mkhyen pa'i phyir zab mo snang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la chos kyi rnam grangs zab mo snang ba zhes bya ba ni chos kyi gzhung 'dis chos thams cad dmigs pa dang mtha' thams cad las 'das par ston cing mkhyen pa'i phyir zab mo snang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: There, the appearance of the profound Dharma-discourse is called the appearance of the profound because this scriptural Dharma teaches and knows that all dharmas transcend all reference points and extremes.

original: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs zhes bya ba ni zab mo de nyid la mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs zhes bya ba ni zab mo de nyid la mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: He entered into concentration means that he was equipoised in that very profound [state].

original: yang de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo spyod pa @282b 'di nyid la rnam par rtog cing /
analyzed: yang de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo spyod pa @282b 'di nyid la rnam par rtog cing /
translated: At that time, the bodhisattva mahāsattva noble Avalokiteśvara, contemplating just this profound practice of the perfection of wisdom,

original: phung po lnga po de nyid la yang rang bzhin gyis stong par blta'o zhes pa la /
analyzed: phung po lnga po de nyid la yang rang bzhin gyis stong par blta'o zhes pa la /
translated: saw that even those five aggregates are empty of intrinsic nature.

original: yang de'i tshe zhes pa ni 'khor 'dus pa dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: yang de'i tshe zhes pa ni 'khor 'dus pa dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i dus na'o //
translated: At that time refers to the time of the assembly of the retinue and entering into equipoise.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po rang bzhin gyis stong par blta'o zhes pa'i bar du ni 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po 'khor de rnams dang / sems can thams cad la thugs brtse ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo nyid la rnam par rtog cing phung po de dag kyang mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid las gzhan du gyur pa gang yang med do zhes bya bar dgongs
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po rang bzhin gyis stong par blta'o zhes pa'i bar du ni 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po 'khor de rnams dang / sems can thams cad la thugs brtse ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo nyid la rnam par rtog cing phung po de dag kyang mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid las gzhan du gyur pa gang yang med do zhes bya bar dgongs
translated: Up to “the noble Avalokiteśvara should be seen as empty of intrinsic nature” means that the noble Avalokiteśvara, out of compassion for the assembly and all sentient beings, contemplates the profound perfection of wisdom, and those aggregates also have no nature that is not empty, which is the non-apprehension of emptiness.

original: pa'o // phung po lnga zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi phung po ni dbu ba'i gong bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: pa'o // phung po lnga zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi phung po ni dbu ba'i gong bu lta bu'o //
translated: The five aggregates are as follows: The form aggregate is like a mass of foam.

original: tshor ba ni chu bur lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshor ba ni chu bur lta bu'o //
translated: Feelings are like bubbles.

original: 'du shes ni smig rgyu lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'du shes ni smig rgyu lta bu'o //
translated: Perceptions are like mirages.

original: 'du byed ni chu shing lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'du byed ni chu shing lta bu'o //
translated: Formations are like plantain trees.

original: rnam par shes pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: Consciousness is like an illusion.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhes pa ni phung po lnga po de dag rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhes pa ni phung po lnga po de dag rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid de /
translated: The phrase “empty of intrinsic nature” means that those five aggregates are empty of the characteristic of intrinsic nature.

original: mtha' thams cad las 'das shing mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: mtha' thams cad las 'das shing mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid do //
translated: Because they transcend all extremes and are devoid of characteristics, they are empty.🔽Then, through the power of the Buddha, the venerable Śāriputra said this to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Ārya Avalokiteśvara:

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po la 'di skad ces smras so zhes pa ni nyan thos chen po'i nang na shes rab kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po la 'di skad ces smras so zhes pa ni nyan thos chen po'i nang na shes rab kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i
translated: This shows that among the great hearers, Śāriputra was supreme in wisdom.

original: sh'a ri'i bus de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po la dris so //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po la dris so //
translated: Through the blessing of the Tathāgata, Śāriputra asked Ārya Avalokiteśvara.

original: rigs kyi bu gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo spyod pa spyad par 'dod pa des ji ltar bslab par bya zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo spyod pa spyad par 'dod pa des ji ltar bslab par bya zhes bya ba la ;
translated: Son of noble family, those who wish to practice the profound perfection of wisdom should train in the following way.

original: rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i gsung rab las skyes te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i gsung rab las skyes te /
translated: Son of good family means that one is born from the scriptures of the Great Vehicle,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sras su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sras su gyur pa'o //
translated: and becomes a child of the Tathagata.

original: gang la la zhes pa ni theg pa chen po la zhugs pa gang su yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: gang la la zhes pa ni theg pa chen po la zhugs pa gang su yang rung ba'o //
translated: Whoever refers to anyone who has entered the Great Vehicle.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pas chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid zab mo brjod du med par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pas chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid zab mo brjod du med par spyod pa'o //
translated: Practicing the perfection of wisdom means practicing the perfection of wisdom, practicing the profound inexpressible suchness of all phenomena.

original: spyad par 'dod pa des ji ltar bslab par bya zhes pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don spyad par 'dod pa des ji lta bu zhig tu shes par bya zhing bslab par bya zhes dris pa'o /
analyzed: spyad par 'dod pa des ji ltar bslab par bya zhes pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don spyad par 'dod pa des ji lta bu zhig tu shes par bya zhing bslab par bya zhes dris pa'o /
translated: Those who wish to practice should ask, How should I train? This means that those who wish to practice the meaning of the perfection of wisdom should ask, How should I understand and train?

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / byang @283a * //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / byang @283a * //
translated: When this was said, the bodhisattva

original: chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang pos tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so zhes pa ni dris pa'i lan smras pa'o //
analyzed: chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang pos tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so zhes pa ni dris pa'i lan smras pa'o //
translated: The noble Avalokiteśvara, the bodhisattva, the great being, said to the venerable Śāriputra: this is the answer to the question.

original: sh'a ri'i bu rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo spyad pa spyod par 'dod pa nges 'di ltar brtag par bya ste zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo spyad pa spyod par 'dod pa nges 'di ltar brtag par bya ste zhes pa ni /
translated: Śāriputra, any son or daughter of good family who wishes to practice the profound perfection of wisdom should do it like this:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par 'dod pa des 'og tu bshad pa'i don bzhin du brtag par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par 'dod pa des 'og tu bshad pa'i don bzhin du brtag par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: those who wish to practice the perfection of wisdom should investigate as explained below.

original: phung po lnga po de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong par yang dag par rjes su blta'o zhes pa ni phung po lnga po de dag ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: phung po lnga po de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong par yang dag par rjes su blta'o zhes pa ni phung po lnga po de dag ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid do //
translated: Those five aggregates should be seen as empty of intrinsic nature.

original: mtshan nyid med pas sngon gyi dus nas ma skyes /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pas sngon gyi dus nas ma skyes /
translated: Since they are without characteristics, they are unborn from the past;

original: da ltar gyi dus na mi gnas /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus na mi gnas /
translated: they do not abide in the present;

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na mi 'gag ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na mi 'gag ste /
translated: In the future, it will not cease.

original: dus thams cad du skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gag par ma gyur pas mi gnas pa'i rang bzhin brjod du med pas na stong nyid do //
analyzed: dus thams cad du skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gag par ma gyur pas mi gnas pa'i rang bzhin brjod du med pas na stong nyid do //
translated: Since it does not arise, abide, or cease at all times, it is inexpressible, the nature of nonabiding, and emptiness.

original: blta'o zhes pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du blta'i /
analyzed: blta'o zhes pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du blta'i /
translated: “ One should see” means one should see it as it is.

original: de las gzhan pa gang du yang mi blta'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa gang du yang mi blta'o zhes pa'o //
translated: One should not see it as anything other than that.

original: 'di yan chad ni shes rab la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yan chad ni shes rab la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Up to this point, it is the introduction to wisdom.

original: da ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi don gyis bshad de /
analyzed: da ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi don gyis bshad de /
translated: Now, the meaning of the characteristic of emptiness is explained.

original: gzugs stong pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs stong pa'o //
translated: Form is empty.

original: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so zhes pa la /🔽de la gzugs so zhes pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin khong du ma chud pas 'khrul pa'i sems kyis gzugs su mthong zhing rtog pa'am /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so zhes pa la / de la gzugs so zhes pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin khong du ma chud pas 'khrul pa'i sems kyis gzugs su mthong zhing rtog pa'am /
translated: Emptiness is also form.

original: tshig gis tha snyad du 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gis tha snyad du 'dogs pa'o //
translated: Regarding that, “form” is seeing and conceiving form with a deluded mind because the nature of emptiness is not understood, or it is a verbal designation.

original: stong pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin pas snga ma 'das pa'i dus na yang mtshan nyid med pas dmigs su med /
analyzed: stong pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin pas snga ma 'das pa'i dus na yang mtshan nyid med pas dmigs su med /
translated: “It is empty” means that the nature of form is emptiness. Therefore, since it is devoid of characteristics in the past, it is not apprehended.

original: da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yang mtshan nyid med de /
analyzed: da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yang mtshan nyid med de /
translated: It is also devoid of characteristics in the present and the future.

original: dmigs su med pas mtha' thams cad dang dngos po thams cad mi gnas pa'i phyir stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs su med pas mtha' thams cad dang dngos po thams cad mi gnas pa'i phyir stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Since it is not apprehended, it is said to be “empty” because it does not abide in any extreme or in any entity.

original: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyang dmigs su med pa'i rang bzhin la gzugs so zhes tshig gi tha snyad du btags la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyang dmigs su med pa'i rang bzhin la gzugs so zhes tshig gi tha snyad du btags la /
translated: “Emptiness is form” means that emptiness is also designated as the term “form” in relation to the nature of non-apprehension.

original: de gud na mi gnas pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so //🔽gzugs las stong pa nyid gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: de gud na mi gnas pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so // gzugs las stong pa nyid gzhan ma yin /
translated: Since it does not exist elsewhere, emptiness is also form.

original: stong pa nyid las kyang gzugs gzhan ma yin no zhes pa ni gzugs gang yin pa de nyid brjod du med pa'i stong pa nyid yin @283b gyi ;
analyzed: stong pa nyid las kyang gzugs gzhan ma yin no zhes pa ni gzugs gang yin pa de nyid brjod du med pa'i stong pa nyid yin @283b gyi ;
translated: “Form is not other than emptiness” means that form itself is inexpressible emptiness.

original: gzugs spangs te stong pa nyid btsal du mi rnyed pas na gzugs las stong pa nyid gzhan ma yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs spangs te stong pa nyid btsal du mi rnyed pas na gzugs las stong pa nyid gzhan ma yin zhes bya'o //
translated: Since form is not found when sought apart from emptiness, it is said that emptiness is not other than form.

original: brjod du med pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de nyid la gzugs so zhes tshig gi tha snyad du btags pa gud na mi 'dug cing mi rnyed pa'i phyir stong pa nyid las kyang gzugs gzhan ma yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de nyid la gzugs so zhes tshig gi tha snyad du btags pa gud na mi 'dug cing mi rnyed pa'i phyir stong pa nyid las kyang gzugs gzhan ma yin zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the inexpressible emptiness itself is not something else that is designated by the term “form,” and is not found, it is said that form is not other than emptiness.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams stong pa'o zhes pa ni gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa bzhin du phung po lhag ma rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar blta'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams stong pa'o zhes pa ni gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa bzhin du phung po lhag ma rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar blta'o //
translated: Similarly, “feeling, discrimination, compositional factors, and consciousness are empty” should be understood in the same way as was explained for form.

original: sh'a ri'i bu de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang stong pa nyid de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang stong pa nyid de zhes bya ba la /
translated: Śāriputra, in the same way, all phenomena are emptiness.

original: sh'a ri'i bu zhes pa ni ma yengs par legs par nyon cig ces bod pa'i tshig go /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu zhes pa ni ma yengs par legs par nyon cig ces bod pa'i tshig go /
translated: Śāriputra, the words “listen well” mean “do not be distracted.”

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad stong pa nyid ni phung po lnga la ji ltar bshad pa ltar gzhan yang skye mched drug nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad stong pa nyid ni phung po lnga la ji ltar bshad pa ltar gzhan yang skye mched drug nas /
translated: Likewise, the emptiness of all phenomena should be understood as emptiness, just as it was explained in the case of the five aggregates, in the case of the six sense-spheres,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad kyang stong pa nyid du shes par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad kyang stong pa nyid du shes par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: and in the case of all supramundane phenomena up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: mtshan nyid med pa zhes pa ni nam mkha' la mtshan nyid med pa ltar nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang med rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyang med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa zhes pa ni nam mkha' la mtshan nyid med pa ltar nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang med rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyang med pa'o //
translated: As for the absence of characteristics, just as space has no characteristics, so too the characteristics of the afflictions do not exist, and the characteristics of purification do not exist.

original: mi skye mi 'gag pa zhes pa ni da ltar skyes pa ni sngon med pa las phyis yod par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mi skye mi 'gag pa zhes pa ni da ltar skyes pa ni sngon med pa las phyis yod par gyur pa'o //
translated: As for the absence of birth and cessation, birth is the later existence of something that did not exist before.

original: 'gag pa ni sngon yod pa las phyis med par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa ni sngon yod pa las phyis med par gyur pa'o //
translated: Cessation is the later nonexistence of something that existed before.

original: stong pa nyid ni dmigs su med pas sngon nas ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni dmigs su med pas sngon nas ma skyes pa'o //
translated: Since emptiness is not an object of apprehension, it is unborn from the beginning.

original: ma skyes pas na phyis mi 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pas na phyis mi 'gag pa'o //
translated: Since it is unborn, it does not cease later.

original: dri ma med pa dang / dri ma dang bral ba med pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dri ma med pa dang / dri ma dang bral ba med pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: stainless and unstained.

original: dri ma zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa rnams kyis gzung 'dzin du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa rnams kyis gzung 'dzin du spyod pa'o //
translated: Here, “stain” means the experience of the consciousnesses as subject and object.

original: stong pa nyid ni rnam par shes pa las 'das pas dri ma med pa'o //🔽dri ma dang bral ba med pa ni dri ma med pas bral ba yang med pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni rnam par shes pa las 'das pas dri ma med pa'o // dri ma dang bral ba med pa ni dri ma med pas bral ba yang med pa'o //
translated: Since emptiness transcends consciousness, it is stainless.🔽“Unstained” means that it is not even devoid of stains.

original: bri ba med pa gang ba med pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bri ba med pa gang ba med pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Neither diminished nor increased.”

original: bri ba zhes bya ba ni sems can no //
analyzed: bri ba zhes bya ba ni sems can no //
translated: Here, “diminished” means sentient beings.

original: gang ba zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: gang ba zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas so //
translated: “Increased” means buddhas.

original: med pa zhes pa ni sems can dang sangs rgyas bcal du yang mi rnyed pas bri ba dang gang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: med pa zhes pa ni sems can dang sangs rgyas bcal du yang mi rnyed pas bri ba dang gang ba med pa'o //
translated: “Neither” means that since neither sentient beings nor buddhas are found, there is neither diminution nor increase.

original: de ltar na stong pa nyid ni gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar na stong pa nyid ni gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, “emptiness is not form.”

original: gzugs ni gzhig par bya ba'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: gzugs ni gzhig par bya ba'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: Here, form has the characteristic of being destroyed.

original: stong pa nyid la mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid ni gzugs ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid ni gzugs ma yin no //
translated: Since emptiness is without characteristics, emptiness is not form.

original: tshor ba ma yin /
analyzed: tshor ba ma yin /
translated: It is not feeling.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba ni myong ba'i @284a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba ni myong ba'i @284a * //
translated: Feeling has the characteristic of experience.

original: mtshan nyid 'du shes ma yin /
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'du shes ma yin /
translated: It is not perception.

original: 'du shes ni 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: 'du shes ni 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: Perception has the characteristic of grasping.

original: 'du byed ma yin /
analyzed: 'du byed ma yin /
translated: It is not formation.

original: 'du byed ni mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: 'du byed ni mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: Formation has the characteristic of conditioning.

original: rnam par shes pa rnams ma yin /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams ma yin /
translated: It is not consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa ni so sor bye brag 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni so sor bye brag 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: Consciousness has the characteristic of individual cognition.

original: stong pa nyid ni dmigs su med pas rnam par shes pa rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni dmigs su med pas rnam par shes pa rnams ma yin no //
translated: Since emptiness is not an object, it is not consciousness.

original: rnams ma yin zhes pa ni phung po lnga rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: rnams ma yin zhes pa ni phung po lnga rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: The five aggregates have the characteristic of being contaminated,

original: stong pa nyid ni phung po lnga rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni phung po lnga rnams ma yin no //
translated: but emptiness is not the five aggregates.

original: mig ma yin /
analyzed: mig ma yin /
translated: It is not the eye.

original: de la mig ni mthong ba'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de la mig ni mthong ba'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: The eye has the characteristic of seeing,

original: stong pa nyid la mtshan nyid med pas stong pa nyid mig ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la mtshan nyid med pas stong pa nyid mig ma yin no //
translated: but since emptiness is without characteristics, emptiness is not the eye.

original: rna ba ma yin /
analyzed: rna ba ma yin /
translated: It is not the ear.

original: de bzhin du rna ba ni thos pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba ni thos pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Similarly, the ear has the characteristic of hearing.

original: sna ma yin /
analyzed: sna ma yin /
translated: It is not the nose.

original: sna ni snom pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: sna ni snom pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: The nose is characterized by smelling.

original: lce ma yin /
analyzed: lce ma yin /
translated: It is not the tongue.

original: lce ni ro myang ba'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: lce ni ro myang ba'i mtshan nyid /
translated: The tongue is characterized by tasting.

original: lus ma yin /
analyzed: lus ma yin /
translated: It is not the body.

original: lus ni reg pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: lus ni reg pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: The body is characterized by touch.

original: yid ma yin /
analyzed: yid ma yin /
translated: It is not the mind.

original: yid ni bye brag gcod pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi ;
analyzed: yid ni bye brag gcod pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi ;
translated: The mind is characterized by discrimination.

original: stong pa nyid ni mtshan nyid med pas yid ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni mtshan nyid med pas yid ma yin no //
translated: Since emptiness is without characteristics, it is not the mind.

original: de ltar dbang po drug po ni 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar dbang po drug po ni 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the six sense faculties are characterized by grasping.

original: stong pa nyid ni mtshan nyid med pas dbang po drug rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni mtshan nyid med pas dbang po drug rnams ma yin no //
translated: Since emptiness is without characteristics, it is not the six sense faculties.

original: gzugs ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs ma yin /
translated: It is not form.

original: gzugs ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: gzugs ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: Form is characterized by color and shape.

original: stong pa nyid ni mtshan nyid med pas gzugs ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni mtshan nyid med pas gzugs ma yin no //
translated: Since emptiness is without characteristics, it is not form.

original: sgra ma yin /
analyzed: sgra ma yin /
translated: It is not sound.

original: de bzhin du sgra ni snyan mi snyan gyi mtshan nyid /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra ni snyan mi snyan gyi mtshan nyid /
translated: Similarly, sound is characterized by being pleasant or unpleasant.

original: dri ma yin /
analyzed: dri ma yin /
translated: It is not smell.

original: dri ni snom pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: dri ni snom pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: Smell is characterized by being smelled.

original: ro ma yin /
analyzed: ro ma yin /
translated: It is not taste.

original: ro ni bro ba'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: ro ni bro ba'i mtshan nyid /
translated: Taste is characterized by being tasted.

original: reg bya ma yin /
analyzed: reg bya ma yin /
translated: It is not tactility.

original: reg bya ni reg pa 'jam rtsub kyi mtshan nyid /
analyzed: reg bya ni reg pa 'jam rtsub kyi mtshan nyid /
translated: Tactility is characterized by being touched, such as being smooth or rough.

original: chos ma yin /
analyzed: chos ma yin /
translated: It is not a phenomenon.

original: chos ni bye brag gi rnam pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: chos ni bye brag gi rnam pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: A phenomenon is characterized by a particular form.

original: stong pa nyid ni mtshan nyid med pas chos ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni mtshan nyid med pas chos ma yin no //
translated: Since emptiness is not a characteristic, it is not a phenomenon.

original: de ltar na yul rnams ni dmigs par byed pa'i rkyen gyi mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na yul rnams ni dmigs par byed pa'i rkyen gyi mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: In this way, objects are characterized by being conditions that are observed.

original: stong pa nyid ni mtshan nyid med pas yul rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni mtshan nyid med pas yul rnams ma yin no //
translated: Since emptiness is not a characteristic, it is not an object.

original: mig gi khams ma yin pa nas /🔽yid kyi khams ma yin /
analyzed: mig gi khams ma yin pa nas / yid kyi khams ma yin /

analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du yang ma yin no //

analyzed: de la khams bco brgyad ni gdug pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /

analyzed: stong pa nyid ni mtshan nyid med pas khams bco brgyad ma yin no //
translated: Since emptiness is not a characteristic, it is not the eighteen elements.

original: ma rig pa ma yin pa nas rga shi ma yin /
analyzed: ma rig pa ma yin pa nas rga shi ma yin /

original: ma rig pa zad pa nas rga shi zad pa'i bar du ma yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa zad pa nas rga shi zad pa'i bar du ma yin no //
translated: It is not the exhaustion of ignorance, and it is not the exhaustion of aging and death.

analyzed: ma rig pa nas rga shi'i @284b bar du rten 'brel bcu gnyis ni 'khor ba 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: The twelve links of dependent origination, from ignorance to aging and death, are characterized by grasping saṃsāra.

original: stong pa nyid ni mtshan nyid ma yin pas ma rig pa nas rga shi'i bar du ma yin no //🔽ma rig pa zad pa nas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni mtshan nyid ma yin pas ma rig pa nas rga shi'i bar du ma yin no // ma rig pa zad pa nas /
translated: Emptiness is not the characteristic of ignorance up to old age and death.

original: rga shi zad pa'i bar du rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: rga shi zad pa'i bar du rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: The exhaustion of ignorance up to the exhaustion of old age and death are the characteristics of purification.

original: stong pa nyid ni mtshan nyid med pas ma rig pa zad pa nas rga shi zad pa'i bar du ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni mtshan nyid med pas ma rig pa zad pa nas rga shi zad pa'i bar du ma yin no //
translated: Emptiness is not the exhaustion of ignorance up to the exhaustion of old age and death because emptiness is without characteristics.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not the truth of suffering, the truth of origination, the truth of cessation, or the truth of the path.

original: sdug bsngal ni nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: Suffering is characterized by affliction.

original: kun 'byung ba ni nye bar len pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba ni nye bar len pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: Origination is characterized by appropriation.

original: 'gog pa ni zhi ba'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: 'gog pa ni zhi ba'i mtshan nyid /
translated: Cessation is characterized by peace.

original: lam ni shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: lam ni shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: The path is characterized by knowledge.

original: stong pa nyid la mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid bden pa bzhi ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid bden pa bzhi ma yin no //
translated: Emptiness is not the four truths because emptiness is without characteristics.

original: ye shes ma yin /
analyzed: ye shes ma yin /
translated: It is not knowledge.

original: ye shes ni chos thams cad mngon sum du gyur pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: ye shes ni chos thams cad mngon sum du gyur pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: Knowledge is characterized by the direct perception of all phenomena.

original: stong pa nyid la mtshan nyid med pas ye shes ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la mtshan nyid med pas ye shes ma yin no //
translated: Since emptiness has no characteristics, it is not wisdom.

original: thob pa ma yin /
analyzed: thob pa ma yin /
translated: It is not attainment.

original: ma thob pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ma thob pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is also not non-attainment.

original: thob pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: thob pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: Attainment is unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: ma thob pa ni sems can gyis bla na med pa ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: ma thob pa ni sems can gyis bla na med pa ma thob pa'o //
translated: Non-attainment is sentient beings not attaining unsurpassed [enlightenment].

original: ma yin no zhes pa ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid la bla na med pa'i byang chub kyang med /🔽sems can yang med pas thob pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: ma yin no zhes pa ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid la bla na med pa'i byang chub kyang med / sems can yang med pas thob pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not means that in the characteristic of emptiness, there is no unsurpassed enlightenment,

original: ma thob pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ma thob pa yang ma yin no //
translated: and there are no sentient beings, so it is neither attainment nor non-attainment.

original: rnam grangs des na chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: rnam grangs des na chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid de /
translated: By this enumeration, all phenomena are naturally empty.

original: stong pa nyid ni de lta bu yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni de lta bu yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is taught that emptiness is like this.

original: 'di yan chad ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di yan chad ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Up to this point is the characteristic of emptiness.

original: da ni shes rab kyi spyod yul gyi don gyis bshad de /
analyzed: da ni shes rab kyi spyod yul gyi don gyis bshad de /
translated: Now, it is explained by the meaning of the domain of wisdom.

original: sh'a ri'i bu de ltar byang chub sems dpa' thob pa med par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing spyod de zhes pa la /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de ltar byang chub sems dpa' thob pa med par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing spyod de zhes pa la /
translated: “Śāriputra, in this way the bodhisattva, not attaining anything, stands in the perfection of wisdom and practices it.”🔽This is the domain of the perfection of wisdom. If one has just this much, it is explained as a sign of practicing emptiness.

original: ma chud pa la chud do snyam pa 'byung ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod yul 'di tsam zhig dang ldan na stong pa nyid du spyod pa'i mtshan mar bshad pa de ltar zhes pa ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid du gyur pa'i
analyzed: ma chud pa la chud do snyam pa 'byung ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod yul 'di tsam zhig dang ldan na stong pa nyid du spyod pa'i mtshan mar bshad pa de ltar zhes pa ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid du gyur pa'i
translated: “In this way” means that all phenomena are emptiness.

original: phyir ro // byang chub sems dpa' rnams thob pa med par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod ces pa ni thog pa chen po la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis phung po lnga nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar du ci yang thob pa med par
analyzed: phyir ro // byang chub sems dpa' rnams thob pa med par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod ces pa ni thog pa chen po la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis phung po lnga nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar du ci yang thob pa med par
translated: “The bodhisattvas practice the perfection of wisdom without attaining anything” means that the bodhisattvas who have entered the great vehicle do not attain anything at all, from the five aggregates up to omniscience.

original: shes shing chos gang yang rdul tsam rjes su mi mthong bar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: shes shing chos gang yang rdul tsam rjes su mi mthong bar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: One should practice the perfection of wisdom without seeing even an atom of any phenomenon.

original: chos thams cad stong pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are empty.

original: mi gnas pa'i rang @285a * //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i rang @285a * //
translated: Although they are by nature non-abiding,

original: bzhin yin yang de ltar mi shes pa'i ma rig pa'i 'khrul pa'i sems kyis mun par gyur pas srid pa'i rgya mtshor 'khor zhing 'khyam mo //
analyzed: bzhin yin yang de ltar mi shes pa'i ma rig pa'i 'khrul pa'i sems kyis mun par gyur pas srid pa'i rgya mtshor 'khor zhing 'khyam mo //
translated: the deluded mind of ignorance, not knowing this, is in darkness, and so one wanders and roams in the ocean of existence.

original: 'khrul pa'i sems de nyid ci yin zhes shes rab rnam gsum gyis brtags na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i sems de nyid ci yin zhes shes rab rnam gsum gyis brtags na /
translated: If one examines with the three kinds of wisdom what exactly this deluded mind is,

original: sems ni dmigs su med pas nyon mongs pa yang mi mthong /
analyzed: sems ni dmigs su med pas nyon mongs pa yang mi mthong /
translated: since the mind is not an object, one does not see afflictions.

original: rnam par byang bar yang mi mthong /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar yang mi mthong /
translated: One does not see purification.

original: phung po lnga nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar du yang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: phung po lnga nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar du yang mi mthong ngo //
translated: One does not see the five aggregates up to omniscience.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan nyid med pa dang / mi skye ba dang / mi 'gag pa la sogs pa yang mi mthong /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan nyid med pa dang / mi skye ba dang / mi 'gag pa la sogs pa yang mi mthong /
translated: One does not see emptiness, the absence of characteristics, non-arising, non-cessation, and so forth.

original: shes rab nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: shes rab nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: One does not see even wisdom itself.

original: ci yang mthong ba med pa de ni sems kyi ngo bo nyid mthong ba'o //
analyzed: ci yang mthong ba med pa de ni sems kyi ngo bo nyid mthong ba'o //
translated: Not seeing anything at all is seeing the essence of mind.

original: de ltar sems kyi ngo bo nyid mthong ba de ni byang chub mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar sems kyi ngo bo nyid mthong ba de ni byang chub mthong ngo //
translated: Seeing the essence of mind like that is seeing awakening.

original: gang byang chub mthong ba de ni chos nyid kyis sangs rgyas mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gang byang chub mthong ba de ni chos nyid kyis sangs rgyas mthong ba'o //
translated: Seeing awakening is seeing the buddhas by way of the intrinsic nature.

analyzed: chos nyid kyis sangs rgyas mthong ba des ni bdag nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: Seeing the buddhas by way of the intrinsic nature is oneself fully awakening to unsurpassed awakening.

original: skabs 'dir ni the tshom pas smras pa /
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni the tshom pas smras pa /
translated: At this point, the one with doubts said,

original: de ltar ci yang med pa sha stag tu bshad pas mu stegs can chad par lta ba dang / nyan thos zhi ba'i 'gog pa'i nang du ltung bar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ci yang med pa sha stag tu bshad pas mu stegs can chad par lta ba dang / nyan thos zhi ba'i 'gog pa'i nang du ltung bar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: “Since everything is explained as being nothing at all, will the tīrthikas not fall into the view of annihilation, and will the śrāvakas not fall into the cessation of peace?”

original: lan du smras pa /
analyzed: lan du smras pa /
translated: In response, it was said,

original: de ltar mi 'gyur te mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sems can gyi don byed cing bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsngo ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis spyod par byed pas de ltar skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar mi 'gyur te mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sems can gyi don byed cing bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsngo ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis spyod par byed pas de ltar skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It will not be so, because one acts for the sake of sentient beings by way of non-apprehension, and one dedicates to unexcelled enlightenment, and one practices the six perfections and so forth by way of non-apprehension. Thus, there is no fault.

original: 'di yan chad ni shes rab kyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: 'di yan chad ni shes rab kyi spyod yul lo //
translated: Up to this point, it is the domain of wisdom.

original: da ni shes rab kyi yon tan gyis bshad de /
analyzed: da ni shes rab kyi yon tan gyis bshad de /
translated: Now, it is explained by the qualities of wisdom.

original: sems la skrag pa med pas sgrib pa med de ;
analyzed: sems la skrag pa med pas sgrib pa med de ;
translated: Since there is no fear in the mind, there is no obscuration.

original: phyin ci log las shin du 'das nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar phyin to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyin ci log las shin du 'das nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar phyin to zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having completely transcended error, one reaches the end of nirvana.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stong pa nyid don la thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i bar du mi skrag pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stong pa nyid don la thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i bar du mi skrag pas /
translated: Since one is not afraid of the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom, from listening to the meaning up to contemplating and meditating,

analyzed: sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa dang / bag chags thams cad zlog par byed pas na /
translated: one turns back all the habitual tendencies of the mind, the intellect, and consciousness.

original: sems kyi sgrib pa med ces bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyi sgrib pa med ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “the mind without obscuration.”

translated: Having transcended the sphere of activity of the tīrthikas, śrāvakas, and pratyekabuddhas, like a child, he exhausted all the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chen por phyin to//
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen por phyin to//
translated: He arrived at great nirvāṇa.

original: @285b 'di yan chad ni shes rab kyi yon tan no //
analyzed: @285b 'di yan chad ni shes rab kyi yon tan no //
translated: Up to this point is the explanation of the qualities of wisdom.

analyzed: da ni shes rab kyi 'bras bu'i don gyis bshad de /
translated: Now, the explanation by way of the meaning of the result of wisdom is as follows.

analyzed: dus gsum du rnam par gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su mngon par sangs rgyas so zhes pa la /

translated: The buddhas who have gone in the worlds of the ten directions in the three times have all held this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: klog / kha ton byed /
analyzed: klog / kha ton byed /
translated: read it, recited it from memory,

analyzed: sgom / gzhan la ston cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: and having taught it to others, they have attained perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment by practicing the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyang /
translated: And all the Buddhas of the three times

translated: Up to here is the result of wisdom.

analyzed: bdag dang gzhan yang bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya bas na bden te ma nor ba zhes bya'o //

analyzed: bla na med pa'i sngags zhes pa ni /

analyzed: theg pa chen po la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang spyad par bya'o //
translated: the bodhisattvas who have entered the Mahāyāna should also practice it.
